item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, February 13, 2025 at 11:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Privacy Pass Authentication for Kagi Search (352 points | 148 comments)
2. Phind 2: AI search with visual answers and multi-step reasoning (248 points | 95 comments)
3. MapTCHA, the open-source CAPTCHA that improves OpenStreetMap [video] (99 points | 17 comments)
4. Show HN: SQL Noir – Learn SQL by solving crimes (39 points | 14 comments)
5. Nvidia Security Team: "What if we just stopped using C?" (2022) (47 points | 15 comments)
6. Why does Mill use Scala? (48 points | 20 comments)
7. Hyperbound (YC S23) Is Hiring a Founding Full-Stack Engineer in SF ( | hide)
8. Who exactly needs to get approval from an institutional review board (IRB)? (178 points | 120 comments)
9. Basis of the Kalman Filter [pdf] (133 points | 16 comments)
10. Cheap solar power is sending electrical grids into a death spiral (34 points | 29 comments)
11. JesseSort: A novel sorting algorithm that is faster than Python's default sort. (27 points | 6 comments)
12. LibreOffice still kicking at 40, now with browser tricks and real-time collab (345 points | 128 comments)
13. Fewer students are enrolling in doctoral degrees (89 points | 157 comments)
14. MESI Cache Coherency Protocol Visualization (19 points | 1 comment)
15. SQL pipe syntax available in public preview in BigQuery (184 points | 91 comments)
16. Tolerating full cloud outages with Monzo Stand-in (50 points | 31 comments)
17. Magnetic field sorting of superconducting graphite particles with Tc>400K (2024) (55 points | 31 comments)
18. Self hosted FLOSS fitness/workout tracker (168 points | 91 comments)
19. Description Language for managing file/folder naming conventions (3 points | 3 comments)
20. WASM-Native Orchestration (62 points | 23 comments)
21. The Human Alphabet (15 points | 3 comments)
22. Why Does Integer Addition Approximate Float Multiplication? (152 points | 61 comments)
23. Learning fast and accurate absolute pitch judgment in adulthood (66 points | 28 comments)
24. Better text rendering in Chromium-based browsers on Windows (130 points | 109 comments)
25. Banksy Fights with Greeting Card Company for Control of His Trademark (16 points | 4 comments)
26. Cheap blood test detects pancreatic cancer before it spreads (302 points | 179 comments)
27. Resigning as Asahi Linux project lead (904 points | 751 comments)
28. An Infinitely Large Napkin [pdf] (2019) (163 points | 27 comments)
29. Smuggling arbitrary data through an emoji (664 points | 181 comments)
30. Residential Networking over Telephone (90 points | 35 comments)
